title: Practice Exercise
description:
**Your Turn!**

Now it's time to write your own code. In the code editor below, you'll see some starter code with blanks (shown as `____`).

**Your task:** Replace the blanks to make Python print your own message.

- Replace `____` with the command that displays text
- Inside the parentheses, write **your own message** (remember the quotes!)
- Click 'Run Code' to see your message appear

**Bonus Challenge:** Add a second `print()` line to display a second message!
instructions:
**Your Turn!**

Now it's time to write your own code. In the code editor below, you'll see some starter code with blanks (shown as `____`).

**Your task:** Replace the blanks to make Python print your own message.

- Replace `____` with the command that displays text
- Inside the parentheses, write **your own message** (remember the quotes!)
- Click 'Run Code' to see your message appear

**Bonus Challenge:** Add a second `print()` line to display a second message!

testCases.description: Code runs without errors and produces output

hints.text:
**Hint:** The command to display text is `print`. Remember to keep the quotation marks around your message!

Your code should look like: `print("Your message here")`

commonMistakes.mistake: print(Hello)  ❌ Wrong - Python thinks Hello is a variable
commonMistakes.correction: Review the correct syntax in the examples
Review the correct syntax in the examples

commonMistakes.mistake: print("Hello')  ❌ Wrong - starts with " but ends with '
commonMistakes.correction: Review the correct syntax in the examples
